titles.title: To prevent the retroactive application of changes to Trans-Alaska Pipeline Quality Bank valuation methodologies.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Air Quality.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

bill.summary: 4/28/2005--Introduced. Prohibits the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission from approving any retroactive application of TAPS quality bank valuation methodologies when it reviews Trans-Alaska Pipeline carrier tariffs. Defines such methodologies as valuation methodologies applied for the purpose of establishing monetary adjustments paid by or to shippers of oil on the Trans-Alaska Pipeline through the operation of a quality bank to compensate for differentials in the value of shippers' oil commingled in the pipeline.
